intro: Phaseolus minimus f. lobatus, commonly known as the dwarf bean or miniature bean, is a compact, herbaceous annual plant native to the Americas. It features small, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of tiny, pale green to yellowish flowers. The plant bears small, round to oval pods that contain 2–4 tiny, edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for container gardening and small spaces. Due to its ornamental value and edible yield, it is cultivated in both gardens and for commercial use.
